summary: The Expanding Penalty Free Withdrawal Act (H.R. 329) amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals experiencing long-term unemployment to withdraw funds from their retirement plans without the standard 10% early withdrawal penalty. To be eligible, an individual must have received unemployment compensation for at least 26 consecutive weeks. The penalty-free withdrawal is limited to the lesser of $50,000 or the greater of $10,000 or 50% of the person's retirement account value. The bill applies to distributions made after December 31, 2024, providing financial relief for those facing extended joblessness.
